description.value: The subject has a +4 enhancement bonus to Wisdom.
The subject has a +4 enhancement bonus to Intelligence.
You have a luck bonus to attack rolls and weapon damage rolls. Usage : Set the buff's level equal to the caster level Divine Favor.
The subject of Virtue gains 1 temporary hit point.
The subject has a +4 enhancement bonus to Strength.
You take a -1 penalty on attack rolls and saving throws vs fear effects.
The target of Guidance gets a +1 competence bonus on a single skill check. It must choose to use the bonus before making the roll to which it applies.

A barbarian can fly into a rage a certain number of times per day. In a rage, a barbarian temporarily gains a +4 bonus to Strength, a +4 bonus to Constitution, and a +2 morale bonus on Will saves, but he takes a -2 penalty to Armor Class. The increase in Constitution increases the barbarian's hit points by 2 points per level, but these hit points go away at the end of the rage when his Constitution score drops back to normal. (These extra hit points are not lost first the way temporary hit points are.) While raging, a barbarian cannot use any Charisma-, Dexterity-, or Intelligence-based skills (except for Balance, Escape Artist, Intimidate, and Ride), the Concentration skill, or any abilities that require patience or concentration, nor can he cast spells or activate magic items that require a command word, a spell trigger (such as a wand), or spell completion (such as a scroll) to function. He can use any feat he has except Combat Expertise, item creation feats, and metamagic feats. A fit of rage lasts for a number of rounds equal to 3 + the character's (newly improved) Constitution modifier. Usage: Set the buff's level to the 1 for Standard Rage, 2 for Greater Rage and 3 for Mghty Rage

Your mind generates a tangible field of force that provides a +4 armor bonus to Armor Class. Unlike mundane armor, inertial armor entails no armor check penalty or speed reduction. Because inertial armor is composed of psychokinetic force, incorporeal creatures can't bypass it the way they do normal armor. Your inertial armor can be invisible or can appear as a colored glow, at your option. The armor bonus provided by inertial armor does not stack with the armor bonus provided by regular armor.
An invisible but tangible field of force surrounds you, providing a +4 armor bonus to AC. Since mage armor is made of force, incorporeal creatures can't bypass it the way they do normal armor.
The subject has a +4 enhancement bonus to Charisma.
You have a +1 luck bonus on attack rolls, weapon damage rolls, saves and skill checks.
You are staggered, and you have a -1 penalty to attack rolls, AC and Reflex saves. In addition, you move at half speed (round down to the next 5-foot increment).

A bard of 15th level or higher with 18 or more ranks in a Perform skill can use music or poetics to inspire tremendous heroism in himself or a single willing ally within 30 feet. For every three bard levels the character attains beyond 15th, he can inspire heroics in one additional creature. To inspire heroics, a bard must sing and an ally must hear the bard sing for a full round. A creature so inspired gains a +4 morale bonus on saving throws and a +4 dodge bonus to AC. The effect lasts for as long as the ally hears the bard sing and for up to 5 rounds thereafter. Inspire heroics is a mind-affecting ability.
You have a +1 morale bonus to attack rolls and saves against fear effects.
The target of Guidance gets a +1 competence bonus on a single saving throw. It must choose to use the bonus before making the roll to which it applies.

Once per day, for up to 4 rounds, a maenad can subjugate her mentality to gain a boost of raw physical power. When she does so, she takes a -2 penalty to Intelligence and Wisdom but gains a +2 bonus to Strength.
You have a deflection bonus to AC. Usage : Set this buff's level equal to the caster level of Shield of Faith.
The target of Guidance gets a +1 competence bonus on a single attack roll. It must choose to use the bonus before making the roll to which it applies.
Summoned creature gains a +4 enhancement bonus to Strength and Constitution for the duration of the spell that summoned it.
The subject has a +4 enhancement bonus to Dexterity.

He gains +2 to Strength, +4 to Constitution, a +2 resistance bonus on all saves, and a +4 dodge bonus to AC. The increase in Constitution increases the defenders hit points by 2 points per level, but these hit points go away at the end of the defensive stance when the Constitution score drops back 4 points. These extra hit points are not lost first the way temporary hit points are. While in a defensive stance, a defender cannot use skills or abilities that would require him to shift his position. A defensive stance lasts for a number of rounds equal to 3 + the characters (newly improved) Constitution modifier. A defender may end his defensive stance voluntarily prior to this limit. At the end of the defensive stance, the defender is winded and takes a -2 penalty to Strength for the duration of that encounter.

deactivateActions.name: Winded
deactivateActions.action: Create unique "Defensive Stance Winded" from D35E.commonbuffs on self;Activate buff "Defensive Stance Winded" on self;

description.value: Your skin is toughened, granting you an enhancement bonus to your natural armor as per the barkskin spell. Usage : Set the buff's level to the caster level of Barkskin.
You have a +1 luck bonus on attack rolls, weapon damage rolls, saves and skill checks.
The subject has a +4 enhancement bonus to Constitution.
The subject of Resistance gains +1 resistance bonus on saves.

A bard of 9th level or higher with 12 or more ranks in a Perform skill can use music or poetics to inspire greatness in himself or a single willing ally within 30 feet, granting him or her extra fighting capability. For every three levels a bard attains beyond 9th, he can target one additional ally with a single use of this ability (two at 12th level, three at 15th, four at 18th). To inspire greatness, a bard must sing and an ally must hear him sing. The effect lasts for as long as the ally hears the bard sing and for 5 rounds thereafter. A creature inspired with greatness gains 2 bonus Hit Dice (d10s), the commensurate number of temporary hit points (apply the targets Constitution modifier, if any, to these bonus Hit Dice), a +2 competence bonus on attack rolls, and a +1 competence bonus on Fortitude saves. The bonus Hit Dice count as regular Hit Dice for determining the effect of spells that are Hit Dice dependant. Inspire greatness is a mind-affecting ability.

When making a full attack action, you may make one extra attack with one natural or manufactured weapon at your highest base attack bonus. This effect is not cumulative with similar effects, such as that provided by a speed weapon. You also gain a +1 bonus on attack rolls, dodge AC and Reflex saves. All your modes of movement (including land, fly, burrow, climb and swim) increase by 30ft, to a maximum of twice your normal speed using that form of movement. This increase counts as an enhancement bonus, and it affects the creature's jumping distance as normal for increased speed
An invisible shield of force hovers in front of you, with the following effects: +4 Shield Bonus to AC Negates Magic Missile attacks direct at you These bonuses apply to incorporeal touch attacks.
-5 penalty on Listen and Spot checks and a -2 penalty on Will saves against sleep effects while the Lullaby is in effect. Note: Duration is Concentration + 1 so the buff must be deleted by the GM.
You have a +1 morale bonus to attack rolls and saves against fear effects.

Someone is inspiring you with courage. You gain a morale bonus on saves vs charm and fear effects, and a competence bonus on attack rolls and weapon damage rolls. Usage : Set the buff's level to the bard level of the person using Inspire Courage.

contextNotes: +[[1 + max(0, ceil((@item.level - 7) / 6))]] Morale vs Fear and Charm effects

description.value: Increase your speed by 10 feet, plus 10 feet per four character levels beyond 1st, to a maximum increase of 30 feet at 9th character level and higher. These bursts of speed are considered a competence bonus to the your base speed. A burst of speed lasts 3 rounds.
You gain a +2 morale bonus on attack rolls, saves, and skill checks.

A fatigued character can neither run nor charge and takes a -2 penalty to Strength and Dexterity. Doing anything that would normally cause fatigue causes the fatigued character to become exhausted. After 8 hours of complete rest, fatigued characters are no longer fatigued.
